verses.kjv: And it came to pass, that, as he was praying in a certain place, when he ceased, one of his disciples said unto him, Lord, teach us to pray, as John also taught his disciples.
verses.ct: One time Jesus was praying in a particular spot, and after he finished, one of his disciples said to him, "Lord, show us how to pray, just like John taught his disciples."

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, When ye pray, say, Our Father which art in heaven, Hallowed be thy name. Thy kingdom come. Thy will be done, as in heaven, so in earth.
verses.ct: He told them, "When you pray, say: 'Father in heaven, may your name be honored as holy. May your kingdom come. May your will be carried out on earth just as it is in heaven.

verses.kjv: Give us day by day our daily bread.
verses.ct: Provide us with the food we need each day.

verses.kjv: And forgive us our sins; for we also forgive every one that is indebted to us. And lead us not into temptation; but deliver us from evil.
verses.ct: Forgive us our sins, because we also forgive everyone who wrongs us. And don't let us be led into temptation, but rescue us from evil.'"

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, Which of you shall have a friend, and shall go unto him at midnight, and say unto him, Friend, lend me three loaves;
verses.ct: Then he said to them, "Imagine one of you goes to a friend's house at midnight and says, 'Friend, let me borrow 3 loaves of bread.

verses.kjv: For a friend of mine in his journey is come to me, and I have nothing to set before him?
verses.ct: A friend of mine just arrived from a trip, and I don't have any food to offer him.'

verses.kjv: And he from within shall answer and say, Trouble me not: the door is now shut, and my children are with me in bed; I cannot rise and give thee.
verses.ct: And the friend inside replies, 'Don't bother me. The door is already locked, and my children are in bed with me. I can't get up and give you anything.'

verses.kjv: I say unto you, Though he will not rise and give him, because he is his friend, yet because of his importunity he will rise and give him as many as he needeth.
verses.ct: I'm telling you, even if he won't get up and help just because of their friendship, he will eventually get up and give him whatever he needs because of his persistent asking.

verses.kjv: And I say unto you, Ask, and it shall be given you; seek, and ye shall find; knock, and it shall be opened unto you.
verses.ct: So I'm telling you: ask, and it will be given to you; search, and you will find; knock, and the door will be opened for you.

verses.kjv: For every one that asketh receiveth; and he that seeketh findeth; and to him that knocketh it shall be opened.
verses.ct: Because everyone who asks receives, everyone who searches finds, and for everyone who knocks, the door will be opened.

verses.kjv: If a son shall ask bread of any of you that is a father, will he give him a stone? or if he ask a fish, will he for a fish give him a serpent?
verses.ct: Which father among you, if his son asks for bread, would hand him a stone? Or if he asks for a fish, would give him a snake instead?

verses.kjv: Or if he shall ask an egg, will he offer him a scorpion?
verses.ct: Or if he asks for an egg, would hand him a scorpion?

verses.kjv: If ye then, being evil, know how to give good gifts unto your children: how much more shall your heavenly Father give the Holy Spirit to them that ask him?
verses.ct: So if you, despite being sinful, know how to give good things to your children, how much more will your heavenly Father give the Holy Spirit to those who ask him?"

verses.kjv: And he was casting out a devil, and it was dumb. And it came to pass, when the devil was gone out, the dumb spake; and the people wondered.
verses.ct: Jesus was driving out a demon that had made a man unable to speak. When the demon left, the man who had been mute started talking, and the crowd was amazed.

verses.kjv: But some of them said, He casteth out devils through Beelzebub the chief of the devils.
verses.ct: But some of them said, "He drives out demons by the power of Beelzebub, the ruler of demons."

verses.kjv: And others, tempting him, sought of him a sign from heaven.
verses.ct: Others were trying to test him by demanding a miraculous sign from heaven.

verses.kjv: But he, knowing their thoughts, said unto them, Every kingdom divided against itself is brought to desolation; and a house divided against a house falleth.
verses.ct: But he knew what they were thinking and said to them, "Any kingdom torn apart by civil war will be destroyed, and a household divided against itself will collapse.

verses.kjv: If Satan also be divided against himself, how shall his kingdom stand? because ye say that I cast out devils through Beelzebub.
verses.ct: So if Satan is fighting against himself, how can his kingdom survive? I ask this because you claim I drive out demons through Beelzebub.

verses.kjv: And if I by Beelzebub cast out devils, by whom do your sons cast them out? therefore shall they be your judges.
verses.ct: And if I drive out demons by Beelzebub's power, then by whose power do your own followers drive them out? That's why they will be the ones to judge you.

verses.kjv: But if I with the finger of God cast out devils, no doubt the kingdom of God is come upon you.
verses.ct: But if I drive out demons by the power of God, then the kingdom of God has arrived right in front of you.

verses.kjv: When a strong man armed keepeth his palace, his goods are in peace:
verses.ct: When a powerful, well-armed man guards his own estate, his possessions are safe.

verses.kjv: But when a stronger than he shall come upon him, and overcome him, he taketh from him all his armour wherein he trusted, and divideth his spoils.
verses.ct: But when someone even stronger attacks and overpowers him, that stronger one strips away all the weapons he relied on and distributes everything he owned.

verses.kjv: He that is not with me is against me: and he that gathereth not with me scattereth.
verses.ct: Whoever isn't on my side is against me, and whoever doesn't gather with me is scattering.

verses.kjv: When the unclean spirit is gone out of a man, he walketh through dry places, seeking rest; and finding none, he saith, I will return unto my house whence I came out.
verses.ct: When an evil spirit leaves a person, it roams through barren places looking for rest. When it doesn't find any, it says, 'I'll go back to the home I left.'

verses.kjv: And when he cometh, he findeth it swept and garnished.
verses.ct: When it returns, it finds the place cleaned up and put in order.

verses.kjv: Then goeth he, and taketh to him seven other spirits more wicked than himself; and they enter in, and dwell there: and the last state of that man is worse than the first.
verses.ct: Then it goes and brings along 7 other spirits more wicked than itself, and they all move in and settle there. So that person ends up far worse off than before."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, as he spake these things, a certain woman of the company lifted up her voice, and said unto him, Blessed is the womb that bare thee, and the paps which thou hast sucked.
verses.ct: While he was saying these things, a woman in the crowd called out, "How blessed is the mother who gave birth to you and nursed you!"

verses.kjv: But he said, Yea rather, blessed are they that hear the word of God, and keep it.
verses.ct: But he replied, "Even more blessed are those who hear God's word and obey it."

verses.kjv: And when the people were gathered thick together, he began to say, This is an evil generation: they seek a sign; and there shall no sign be given it, but the sign of Jonas the prophet.
verses.ct: As the crowds grew larger, he began to say, "This is a wicked generation. They demand a miraculous sign, but the only sign they will receive is the sign of Jonah the prophet.

verses.kjv: For as Jonas was a sign unto the Ninevites, so shall also the Son of man be to this generation.
verses.ct: Just as Jonah served as a sign to the people of Nineveh, the Son of Man will be a sign to this generation.

verses.kjv: The queen of the south shall rise up in the judgment with the men of this generation, and condemn them: for she came from the utmost parts of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon; and, behold, a greater than Solomon is here.
verses.ct: The Queen of the South will stand up at the judgment alongside the people of this generation and condemn them, because she traveled from the farthest corners of the earth to hear Solomon's wisdom — and look, someone greater than Solomon is right here.

verses.kjv: The men of Nineve shall rise up in the judgment with this generation, and shall condemn it: for they repented at the preaching of Jonas; and, behold, a greater than Jonas is here.
verses.ct: The people of Nineveh will stand up at the judgment alongside this generation and condemn it, because they turned from their sins when Jonah preached to them — and look, someone greater than Jonah is right here.

verses.kjv: No man, when he hath lighted a candle, putteth it in a secret place, neither under a bushel, but on a candlestick, that they which come in may see the light.
verses.ct: Nobody lights a lamp and then hides it away or puts it under a basket. Instead, they place it on a stand so that people who come in can see the light.

verses.kjv: The light of the body is the eye: therefore when thine eye is single, thy whole body also is full of light; but when thine eye is evil, thy body also is full of darkness.
verses.ct: Your eye is the lamp of your body. When your eye is healthy, your whole body is filled with light. But when your eye is bad, your body is filled with darkness.

verses.kjv: Take heed therefore that the light which is in thee be not darkness.
verses.ct: So be careful that the light inside you hasn't actually become darkness.

verses.kjv: If thy whole body therefore be full of light, having no part dark, the whole shall be full of light, as when the bright shining of a candle doth give thee light.
verses.ct: If your whole body is full of light, with no dark part at all, then it will be completely radiant — like when a lamp shines its bright light on you."

verses.kjv: And as he spake, a certain Pharisee besought him to dine with him: and he went in, and sat down to meat.
verses.ct: After he finished speaking, a Pharisee invited him to eat at his home. So Jesus went in and took his place at the table.

verses.kjv: And when the Pharisee saw it, he marvelled that he had not first washed before dinner.
verses.ct: The Pharisee was surprised to notice that Jesus didn't perform the ritual hand-washing before the meal.

verses.kjv: And the Lord said unto him, Now do ye Pharisees make clean the outside of the cup and the platter; but your inward part is full of ravening and wickedness.
verses.ct: The Lord said to him, "You Pharisees clean the outside of the cup and the plate, but inside you are full of greed and wickedness.

verses.kjv: Ye fools, did not he that made that which is without make that which is within also?
verses.ct: You fools! Didn't the one who made the outside also make the inside?

verses.kjv: But rather give alms of such things as ye have; and, behold, all things are clean unto you.
verses.ct: Instead, give generously from what you have, and then everything will be clean for you.

verses.kjv: But woe unto you, Pharisees! for ye tithe mint and rue and all manner of herbs, and pass over judgment and the love of God: these ought ye to have done, and not to leave the other undone.
verses.ct: But how terrible it will be for you Pharisees! You carefully give a tenth of your mint, rue, and every little herb, but you completely ignore justice and the love of God. You should practice these things without neglecting the others.

verses.kjv: Woe unto you, Pharisees! for ye love the uppermost seats in the synagogues, and greetings in the markets.
verses.ct: How terrible it will be for you Pharisees! You love having the most important seats in the synagogues and being greeted with respect in the marketplaces.

verses.kjv: Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! for ye are as graves which appear not, and the men that walk over them are not aware of them.
verses.ct: How terrible it will be for you! You are like unmarked graves that people walk over without even realizing it."

verses.kjv: Then answered one of the lawyers, and said unto him, Master, thus saying thou reproachest us also.
verses.ct: One of the experts in religious law spoke up and said, "Teacher, when you say these things, you're insulting us too."

verses.kjv: And he said, Woe unto you also, ye lawyers! for ye lade men with burdens grievous to be borne, and ye yourselves touch not the burdens with one of your fingers.
verses.ct: Jesus replied, "How terrible it will be for you experts in the law as well! You pile heavy burdens on people that are impossible to carry, yet you won't lift a single finger to help them.

verses.kjv: Woe unto you! for ye build the sepulchres of the prophets, and your fathers killed them.
verses.ct: How terrible it will be for you! You construct tombs for the prophets, but it was your own ancestors who killed them.

verses.kjv: Truly ye bear witness that ye allow the deeds of your fathers: for they indeed killed them, and ye build their sepulchres.
verses.ct: So you are actually witnesses who approve of what your ancestors did — they murdered the prophets, and you build their tombs.

verses.kjv: Therefore also said the wisdom of God, I will send them prophets and apostles, and some of them they shall slay and persecute:
verses.ct: That is why the wisdom of God declared, 'I will send them prophets and apostles, and they will kill some of them and persecute others.'

verses.kjv: That the blood of all the prophets, which was shed from the foundation of the world, may be required of this generation;
verses.ct: As a result, this generation will be held accountable for the blood of all the prophets that has been spilled since the world began —

verses.kjv: From the blood of Abel unto the blood of Zacharias, which perished between the altar and the temple: verily I say unto you, It shall be required of this generation.
verses.ct: from the blood of Abel all the way to the blood of Zacharias, who was killed between the altar and the temple. Yes, I'm telling you, this generation will be held responsible for all of it.

verses.kjv: Woe unto you, lawyers! for ye have taken away the key of knowledge: ye entered not in yourselves, and them that were entering in ye hindered.
verses.ct: How terrible it will be for you experts in the law! You have taken away the key to knowledge. You didn't enter in yourselves, and you blocked those who were trying to enter."

verses.kjv: And as he said these things unto them, the scribes and the Pharisees began to urge him vehemently, and to provoke him to speak of many things:
verses.ct: After he left there, the scribes and the Pharisees began to pressure him intensely and to bombard him with questions about many topics,

verses.kjv: Laying wait for him, and seeking to catch something out of his mouth, that they might accuse him.
verses.ct: setting traps for him and trying to catch him saying something they could use against him.
